TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SamlAssertion extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a Security Assertion Markup Language 1.1 (SAML 1.1) assertion.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SamlAssertion class corresponds to the `<saml:Assertion>` XML element that is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
The claims for <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens are contained within a SamlAssertion. A SamlAssertion has an extensible set of claims known as SAML statements that are represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Statements%2A> property. The SAML authority that issued the SAML assertion is specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.Issuer%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public SamlAssertion (string assertionId, string issuer, DateTime issueInstant, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions samlConditions, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAdvice samlAdvice, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement> samlStatements);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string assertionId, string issuer, valuetype System.DateTime issueInstant, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions samlConditions, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAdvice samlAdvice, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement> samlStatements) cil managed

Docs.param: The SAML authority that issued this SAML assertion.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that specifies when the SAML assertion was issued.
A that specifies a set of conditions that may be taken into account when assessing the validity of the SAML assertion.
A that specifies additional information supplied by the SAML authority that can aide in the processing of the SAML assertion.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type that contain SAML statements.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified SAML assertion identifier, issuer of the assertion, the date and time when the assertion was issued, a set of processing conditions, additional information, and a collection of SAML statements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `assertionId` parameter must start with a letter or the "_" character.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets additional information related to the that is supplied by the SAML authority that can aide in the processing of the SAML assertion.
Docs.value: A that specifies additional information that is supplied by the SAML authority that can aide in the processing of the SAML assertion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Advice property corresponds to the `<saml:Advice>` element defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS SAML specification.

Docs.exception: The Advice property is set and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly%2A> property is .
Docs.returns: A that specifies additional information that is supplied by the SAML authority that can aide in the processing of the SAML assertion.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identifier for this assertion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The AssertionId property corresponds to the `AssertionID` attribute of the `<saml:Assertion>` element defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.

Docs.exception: The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly%2A> property is and an attempt is made to set the AssertionId property.
An attempt is made to set the AssertionId property to or an empty string.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this assertion was deserialized from XML source and can re-emit the XML data unchanged.
Docs.value: if this assertion can re-emit the XML source data unchanged; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default implementation preserves the source data when read using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.ReadAssertion%2A> method and can re-emit the original data as long as the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml.SamlAssertion.AssertionId%2A> property has not changed from the time that assertion was read.
> [!IMPORTANT] > It is very important that SAML assertions with different data have different IDs. If implementing a scheme whereby an assertion "template" is loaded and certain bits of data are filled in, the Id must be changed.

Docs.returns: if this assertion can re-emit the XML source data unchanged; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a set of conditions that may be taken into account when assessing the validity of the SAML assertion.
Docs.value: A that specifies a set of conditions that may be taken into account when assessing the validity of the SAML assertion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Conditions property corresponds to the `<saml:Conditions>` element defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly%2A> property is and an attempt is made to set the Conditions property.
Docs.returns: A that specifies a set of conditions that may be taken into account when assessing the validity of the SAML assertion.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
Docs.value: if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.

Docs.returns: if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the date and time when the SAML assertion was issued.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> expressed in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) that specifies when the SAML assertion was issued.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The IssueInstant property corresponds to the `IssueInstant` attribute of the `<saml:Assertion>` element defined in the OASIS 1.1 SAML specification.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly%2A> property is and an attempt is made to set the IssueInstant property.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.DateTime> expressed in the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) that specifies when the SAML assertion was issued.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the SAML authority that issued this SAML assertion.
Docs.value: The SAML authority that issued this SAML assertion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Issuer property corresponds to the `Issuer` attribute of the `<saml:Assertion>` element defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly%2A> property is and an attempt is made to set the Issuer property.
An attempt is made to set the Issuer property to or an empty string.
Docs.returns: The SAML authority that issued this SAML assertion.

Docs.summary: Gets the major version of the SAML specification to which this SAML assertion conforms.
Docs.value: The major version of the SAML specification to which this SAML assertion conforms. The default value is the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MajorVersionValue%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The MajorVersion property corresponds to the `MajorVersion` attribute of the `<saml:Assertion>` element defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS SAML specification.

Docs.returns: The major version of the SAML specification to which this SAML assertion conforms. The default value is the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MajorVersionValue%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void MakeReadOnly() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes this instance to be read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets the minor version of the SAML specification to which this SAML assertion conforms.
Docs.value: The minor version of the SAML specification to which this SAML assertion conforms. The default value is the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MinorVersionValue%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The MinorVersion property corresponds to the `MinorVersion` attribute of the `<saml:Assertion>` element defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS SAML specification.

Docs.returns: The minor version of the SAML specification to which this SAML assertion conforms. The default value is the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConstants.MinorVersionValue%2A> property.

A that reads the clause of the digital signature.
A that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
A that is capable of reading XML elements that are defined in the SAML specification.
Docs.summary: Reads the digital signature for a SAML assertion from an XML reader.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the ReadSignature method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningToken%2A> property is set.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ReadXml (System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader reader, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer samlSerializer, System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer keyInfoSerializer, System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver outOfBandTokenResolver);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ReadXml(class System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader reader, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer samlSerializer, class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer keyInfoSerializer, class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver outOfBandTokenResolver) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader> to read the SAML assertion.
A that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML assertion that are defined in the SAML specification.
A that reads the clause of the digital signature.
A that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
Docs.summary: Reads a SAML assertion from the specified XML reader.
Docs.exception: the ReadXml method had been previously called and that SAML assertion was digitally signed.
does not refer to a SAML assertion that is compliant with the SAML 1.1 specification.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the security credentials that are used to digitally sign the SAML assertion.
Docs.value: A that is used to digitally sign the SAML assertion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SigningCredentials property represents the credentials that are used to sign a SAML assertion when it is serialized into XML. Similarly, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningToken%2A> property represents the security token that signed a SAML token in an incoming SOAP message.

Docs.exception: The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly%2A> property is and an attempt is made to set the SigningCredentials property.
Docs.returns: A that is used to digitally sign the SAML assertion.

Docs.summary: Gets the security token contained in or referenced by a digitally signed SAML assertion.
Docs.value: A contained in or referenced by a digitally signed SAML assertion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.ReadXml%2A> method is called and a SAML assertion is digitally signed, the digital signature is set to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningCredentials%2A> property. When the SAML assertion is not digitally signed, the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.SigningCredentials%2A> property is `null`.

Docs.returns: A contained in or referenced by a digitally signed SAML assertion.

Docs.summary: Gets the set of SAML statements associated with the SAML assertion.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type that contains the SAML statements associated with the SAML assertion.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.%23ctor%2A> to set the SAML statements associated with a SAML assertion or add it directly to the collection that is returned by this property when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion.IsReadOnly%2A> property is `false`.
The following table maps the three types of SAML statements defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS SAML specification to their respective types.
|Statement Type|CLR Type| |--------------------|--------------| |Authentication|<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement>| |Attribute|<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement>| |Authorization decision|<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement>| |Statement defined in an extension schema|<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement>| |Subject statement defined in an extension schema|<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement>|

Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type that contains the SAML statements associated with the SAML assertion.

Docs.param: The XML writer with which to write the source data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default implementation preserves the source data when read using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityTokenHandler.ReadAssertion%2A> method and can re-emit the original data as long as the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Saml.SamlAssertion.AssertionId%2A> property has not changed from the time that assertion was read.
> [!IMPORTANT] > It is very important that SAML assertions with different data have different IDs. If implementing a scheme whereby an assertion "template" is loaded and certain bits of data are filled in, the Id must be changed.

Docs.summary: Writes the SAML assertion into the specified XML writer as a element.
